arabicText: وَقَالُوٓا۟ ءَأَـٰلِهَتُنَا خَيْرٌ أَمْ هُوَ ۚ مَا ضَرَبُوهُ لَكَ إِلَّا جَدَلًۢا ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ خَصِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	say,	“Are	our	deities	better	or	he?”	They	did	not	say	this	to	you	except	to	unjustly	argue;	
in	fact	they	are	a	quarrelsome	people.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kahte	haiñ	kiyā	hamāre	m’abood	behtar	haiñ	yā	woh	unhoñ	ne	tum	se	yeh	na	kahi	magar	
nāḥaq	jhagde	ko	balke	woh	haiñ	hi	jhagdālu	log

arabicText: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا عَبْدٌ أَنْعَمْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ مَثَلًۭا لِّبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
englishTranslationText:
He	is	purely	a	bondman	(of	Ours),	whom	We	have	favoured	upon,	and	We	made	him	an	
extraordinary	example	for	the	Descendants	of	Israel.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh		to	nahiñ	magar	aik	banda	jis	par	ham	ne	eḥsān	farmāyā	aur	usey	ham	ne	bani	isrāyil	ke	liye	
'ajeeb	namoona	banāyā

arabicText: وَلَوْ نَشَآءُ لَجَعَلْنَا مِنكُم مَّلَـٰٓئِكَةًۭ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ يَخْلُفُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	if	We	willed,	We	could	have	established	angels	on	the	earth	instead	of	you.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	agar	Ham	chāhte	to	zameen	meiñ	tumhāre	badle	farishte	basāte.

arabicText: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَعِلْمٌۭ لِّلسَّاعَةِ فَلَا تَمْتَرُنَّ بِهَا وَٱتَّبِعُونِ ۚ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌۭ مُّسْتَقِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	Eisa	is	a	sign*	of	the	Last	Day,	
therefore	do	not	ever	doubt	in	the	Last	
Day,	and	obey	Me**;	this	is	the	Straight	
Path.	(*	The	advent	of	Prophet	Eisa	to	earth	
for	the	second	time.	**	By	obeying	the	Noble	
Messenger.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	Ísā	Qiyāmat	ki	khabar	hai	to	
hargiz	Qiyāmat	meiñ	shak	na	karnā	aur	
mere	pairo	honā	yeh	sidhi	rāh	hai.

arabicText: وَلَا يَصُدَّنَّكُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	do	not	ever	let	the	devil	stop	you;	he	is	
indeed	your	open	enemy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hargiz	shaiṭān	tumheñ	na	rok	de	be
shak	woh	tumhārā	khulā	dushman	hai.

arabicText: وَلَمَّا جَآءَ عِيسَىٰ بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ قَالَ قَدْ جِئْتُكُم بِٱلْحِكْمَةِ وَلِأُبَيِّنَ لَكُم بَعْضَ ٱلَّذِى تَخْتَلِفُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	Eisa	came	to	them	with	clear	
signs,	he	said,	“I	have	come	to	you	with	
wisdom,	and	to	explain	to	you	some	of	the	
matters	regarding	which	you	dispute;	
therefore	fear	Allah,	and	obey	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	'Isā	raushan	nishāniyāñ	lāyā	us	ne	
farmāyā	maiñ	tumhāre	pās	ḥikmat	le	kar	
āaya	aur	is	liye	maiñ	tumse	bayān	kar	dooñ	
b'az	woh	bāteñ	jin	meiñ	tum	ikhtilāf	rakhte	
ho	to	Allāh	se	daro	aur	merā	ḥukm	māno

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ رَبِّى وَرَبُّكُمْ فَٱعْبُدُوهُ ۚ هَـٰذَا صِرَٰطٌۭ مُّسْتَقِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“Allah	is	indeed	my	Lord,	and	yours	-	
therefore	worship	Him;	this	is	the	Straight	
Path.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Allāh	merā	Rab	aur	tumhārā	Rab	
to	usey	poojo	yeh	seedhi	rāh	hai

arabicText: فَٱخْتَلَفَ ٱلْأَحْزَابُ مِنۢ بَيْنِهِمْ ۖ فَوَيْلٌۭ لِّلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمٍ أَلِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
Then	the	groups	differed	amongst	
themselves;	therefore	ruin	is	for	the	unjust	
by	the	punishment	of	an	agonising	day.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	woh	giroh	āapas	meiñ	mukhtalif	ho	
gaye	to	zālimoñ	ki	kharābi	hai	aik	dardnāk	
din	ke	'aƶāb	se

arabicText: هَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا ٱلسَّاعَةَ أَن تَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةًۭ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
What	are	they	waiting	for	-	except	the	Last	
Day,	that	it	may	suddenly	come	upon	them	
while	they	are	unaware?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kāhe	ke	intizār	meiñ	haiñ	magar	Qiyāmat	
ke	ke	un	par	achānak	āa	jāye	aur	unheñ	
khabar	na	ho

arabicText: ٱلْأَخِلَّآءُ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بَعْضُهُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ إِلَّا ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Close	friends	will	turn	into	enemies	of	one	
another	on	that	Day,	except	the	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Gahre	dost	us	din	aik	doosre	ke	dushman	
hoñ	ge	magar	pahezgār

arabicText: يَـٰعِبَادِ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْيَوْمَ وَلَآ أَنتُمْ تَحْزَنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
To	such	will	be	said,	“O	My	bondmen!	This	
day	there	shall	be	no	fear	upon	you,	nor	
any	grief.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	se	farmāyā	jāye	gā	aey	mere	bando	āaj	
na	tum	par	khauf	na	tum	ko	gham	ho

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَكَانُوا۟ مُسْلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText: Those	who	believed	in	Our	signs,	and	were	Muslims.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh		jo	hamāri	Āayatoñ	par	Imān	lāye	aur	Musalmān	they

arabicText: ٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْجَنَّةَ أَنتُمْ وَأَزْوَٰجُكُمْ تُحْبَرُونَ
englishTranslationText: “Enter	Paradise	-	you	and	your	wives	-	and	you	will	be	honoured	guests.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Dākhil	ho	Jannat	meiñ	tum	aur	tumhāri	bibiyāñ	tumhāri	khāṭireñ	hotiñ

arabicText: يُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِصِحَافٍۢ مِّن ذَهَبٍۢ وَأَكْوَابٍۢ ۖ وَفِيهَا مَا تَشْتَهِيهِ ٱلْأَنفُسُ وَتَلَذُّ ٱلْأَعْيُنُ ۖ وَأَنتُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Rounds	of	golden	cups	and	wine	will	be	presented	upon	them;	and	in	it	is	whatever	the	hearts	
wish	for,	and	what	pleases	the	eye;	and	you	will	stay	in	it	forever.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	par	daura	hogā	sone	ke	piyāloñ	aur	jāmoñ	kā	aur	us	meiñ	jo	ji	chāhe	aur	jis	se	āañkh	ko	laƶƶat	
pahuñche	aur	tum	us	meiñ	hamesha	raho	ge

arabicText: وَتِلْكَ ٱلْجَنَّةُ ٱلَّتِىٓ أُورِثْتُمُوهَا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText: “And	this	is	the	Paradise	which	is	bequeathed	to	you,	because	of	your	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	yeh	hai	woh	Jannat	jis	ke	tum	wāris	kiye	gaye	apne	a'amāl	se

arabicText: لَكُمْ فِيهَا فَـٰكِهَةٌۭ كَثِيرَةٌۭ مِّنْهَا تَأْكُلُونَ
englishTranslationText: “For	you	are	many	fruits	in	it,	for	you	to	eat	therefrom.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumhāre	liye	is	meiñ	bahut	mewe	haiñ	ke	un	meiñ	se	khāō

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ فِى عَذَابِ جَهَنَّمَ خَـٰلِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	the	criminals	will	stay	in	the	
punishment	of	hell	forever.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	mujrim	Jahannam	ke	áƶāb	meiñ	
hamesha	rahne	wāle	haiñ

arabicText: لَا يُفَتَّرُ عَنْهُمْ وَهُمْ فِيهِ مُبْلِسُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	will	never	be	lightened	upon	them,	and	
they	will	remain	in	it	devastated.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh		kabhi	un	par	se	halkā	na	pade	gā	aur	
woh	us	meiñ	be	āas	raheñ	ge

arabicText: وَمَا ظَلَمْنَـٰهُمْ وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	did	not	oppress	them	at	all,	but	they	
themselves	were	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	un	par	kuchh		zulm	na	kiyā	hāñ	
woh	khud	hi	zālim	they

arabicText: وَنَادَوْا۟ يَـٰمَـٰلِكُ لِيَقْضِ عَلَيْنَا رَبُّكَ ۖ قَالَ إِنَّكُم مَّـٰكِثُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	will	cry	out,	“O	Malik*,	ask	your	Lord	
to	finish	us!”	He	will	answer,	“Rather	you	are	
to	stay	(forever).” (*The guard of hell)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	pukāreñ	ge	aey	mālik	terā	Rab	
hameñ	tamām	kar	chuke	woh	farmāye	gā	
tumheñ	to	thahernā	hai

arabicText: لَقَدْ جِئْنَـٰكُم بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَكُمْ لِلْحَقِّ كَـٰرِهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	have	brought	the	Truth	to	you,	but	
most	of	you	detest	the	Truth.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	tumhāre	pās	ḥaq	lāye	magar	tum	
meiñ	aksar	ko	ḥaq	nāgawār	hai

arabicText: لَقَدْ جِئْنَـٰكُم بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَكُمْ لِلْحَقِّ كَـٰرِهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	have	brought	the	Truth	to	you,	but	
most	of	you	detest	the	Truth.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	tumhāre	pās	ḥaq	lāye	magar	tum	
meiñ	aksar	ko	ḥaq	nāgawār	hai

arabicText: أَمْ أَبْرَمُوٓا۟ أَمْرًۭا فَإِنَّا مُبْرِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Do	they	assume	that	they	have	made	their	
work	thorough?	So	We	shall	make	Our	work	
thorough.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kiyā	unhoñ	ne	apne	khayāl	meiñ	koyi	kām	
pakkā	kar	liyā	hai	to	ham	apnā	kām	karne	
wāle	haiñ

arabicText: أَمْ يَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّا لَا نَسْمَعُ سِرَّهُمْ وَنَجْوَىٰهُم ۚ بَلَىٰ وَرُسُلُنَا لَدَيْهِمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Do	they	fancy	that	We	do	not	listen	to	their	
whispers	and	their	counselling?	Why	not,	We	
surely	do!	And	Our	angels	are	with	them,	
writing	down.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kiyā	is	ghamand	meiñ	haiñ	ke	ham	un	ki	
āahista	bāt	aur	un	ki	mashwarat	nahiñ	sunte	
hāñ	kiyuñ	nahiñ	aur	hamāre	farishte	un	ke	pās	
likh	rahe	haiñ

arabicText: قُلْ إِن كَانَ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ وَلَدٌۭ فَأَنَا۠ أَوَّلُ ٱلْعَـٰبِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	
and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“If	supposedly,	the	
Most	Gracious	had	an	offspring*	-	I	would	be	
the	first	to	worship!”	(*Which	is	impossible)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	bafarz-e-muḥāl	Raḥmān	ke	koyi	
bachcha	hotā	to	sab	se	pahle	maiñ	poojtā

arabicText: سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَرْشِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Purity	is	to	the	Lord	of	the	heavens	and	the	
earth,	the	Lord	of	the	Throne,	from	all	what	
they	fabricate
romanUrduTranslationText:
Pāki	hai	āasmānoñ	aur	zamin	ke	rab	ko	'arsh	
ke	rab	ko	un	bātoñ	se	jo	yeh	banāte	haiñ

arabicText: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا۟ وَيَلْعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يُلَـٰقُوا۟ يَوْمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِى يُوعَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	leave	them	to	utter	vile	speech	and	
to	play,	until	they	confront	the	day	which	they	are	promised.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	tum	unheñ	chodo	ke	behooda	bāteñ	kareñ	
aur	kheleñ	yahāñ	tak	ke	apne	us	din	ko	pāyeñ	
jis	kā	un	se	w'ada	hai

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِلَـٰهٌۭ وَفِى ٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَـٰهٌۭ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْحَكِيمُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	only	He	is	the	God	of	the	heavenly	creation	and	the	God	of	the	earthly	creation;	and	He	only	is	the	
Wise,	the	All	Knowing.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	wohi		āasmān	wāloñ	kā	khudā	aur	zamin	wāloñ	kā	khudā	aur	wohi		ḥikmat-o-'ilm	wālā	hai.

arabicText: وَتَبَارَكَ ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَعِندَهُۥ عِلْمُ ٱلسَّاعَةِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Most	Auspicious	is	He,	for	Whom	is	the	kingship	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth	and	all	that	is	
between	them;	and	only	with	Him	is	the	knowledge	of	the	Last	Day;	and	towards	Him	you	are	to	return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	badi	barkat	wālā	hai	woh	ke	usi	ke	liye	hai	salṭānat	āasmānoñ	aur	zamin	ki	aur	jo	kuch	un	ke	
darmiyān	hai	aur	usi	ke	pās	hai	Qiyāmat	kā	'Ilm	aur	tumheñ	us	ki	ṭaraf	phirnā.

arabicText: وَلَا يَمْلِكُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِ ٱلشَّفَـٰعَةَ إِلَّا مَن شَهِدَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	those	whom	they	worship	besides	Allah	do	not	have	the	right	of	intercession	-	the	right	of	
intercession	is	only	for	those	who	testify	to	the	Truth	and	have	knowledge.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jin	ko	yeh	Allāh	ke	siwā	poojte	haiñ	shafā'at	kā	ikhtiyār	nahiñ	rakhte	hāñ	shafā'at	kā	ikhtiyār	
unheñ	hai	jo	ḥaq	ki	gawāhi	deñ	aur	'Ilm	rakheñ

arabicText: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَهُمْ لَيَقُولُنَّ ٱللَّهُ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ يُؤْفَكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	you	ask	them	as	to	Who	created	them,	they	will	surely	answer	“Allah”	-	so	where	are	they	
reverting?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tum	un	se	poocho	ke	unheñ	kis	ne	paidā	kiyā	to	zaroor	kaheñ	ge	Allāh	ne	to	kahāñ	aundhe	
jāte	haiñ

arabicText: وَقِيلِهِۦ يَـٰرَبِّ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ قَوْمٌۭ لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	saying	of	My	Prophet	“O	my	Lord!	These	people	do	not	accept	faith!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Mujhe	Rasool	ke	is	kahne	ki	qasam	ke	aey	mere	rab	yeh	log	Imān	nahiñ	lāte.

arabicText: فَٱصْفَحْ عَنْهُمْ وَقُلْ سَلَـٰمٌۭ ۚ فَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText: Therefore	excuse	them	and	proclaim,	“Peace”;	for	they	will	soon	come	to	know.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	un	se	darguzar	karo	aur	farmāō	bas	Salām	hai	ke	āage	jān	jāyeñ	ge

arabicText: حمٓ
englishTranslationText:
Ha-Meem*.(*Alphabets	of	the	Arabic	
language;	Allah	and	to	whomever	He	
reveals,	know	their	precise	meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ha-Meem*.(*Arabi	zabān	ke	huroof	jin	ke	
ma’āni	Allah	aur	jis	par	Allah	ne	inko	nazil	
farmaya	Wahi	jānta	hai.)

arabicText: وَٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ٱلْمُبِينِ
englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	this	clear	Book.
romanUrduTranslationText: Qasam	us	raushan	Kitāb	ki

arabicText: إِنَّآ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ فِى لَيْلَةٍۢ مُّبَـٰرَكَةٍ ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا مُنذِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	have	indeed	sent	it	down	in	a	blessed	
night	-	indeed	it	is	We	Who	warn.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	ne	usey	barkat	wāli	rāt	meiñ	
utārā	be-shak	ham	dar	sunāne	wāle	haiñ

arabicText: فِيهَا يُفْرَقُ كُلُّ أَمْرٍ حَكِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
During	it	are	distributed	all	the	works	of	
wisdom.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	meiñ	bāñt	diyā	jātā	hai	har	ḥikmat	wālā	
kām

arabicText: أَمْرًۭا مِّنْ عِندِنَآ ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا مُرْسِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
By	a	command	from	Us	-	indeed	it	is	We	
Who	send.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hamāre	pās	ke	ḥukm	se	be-shak	ham	
bhejne	wāle	haiñ

arabicText: رَحْمَةًۭ مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
A	mercy	from	your	Lord;	indeed	He	only	is	
the	All	Hearing,	the	All	Knowing
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tumhāre	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	se	Raḥmat	be-shak	
wohi		sunta	jāntā	hai.

arabicText: رَبِّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	Lord	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth	and	
all	that	is	between	them;	if	you	people	
believe.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh		jo	Rab	hai	āasmānoñ	aur	zamin	kā	
aur	jo	kuch	un	ke	darmiyān	hai	agar	
tumheñ	yaqin	ho

arabicText: لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ يُحْىِۦ وَيُمِيتُ ۖ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ ءَابَآئِكُمُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
There	is	no	worship	except	for	Him	-	He	
gives	life	and	causes	death;	your	Lord	and	
the	Lord	of	your	forefathers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ke	siwā	kisi	ki	bandagi	nahiñ	woh	jilāye	
aur	māre,	tumhārā	Rab	aur	tumhāre	agle	
bāp	dādā	kā	rab

arabicText: بَلْ هُمْ فِى شَكٍّۢ يَلْعَبُونَ
englishTranslationText: Rather	they	are	in	doubt,	playing.
romanUrduTranslationText: Balke	woh	shak	meiñ	pade	khel	rahe	haiñ

arabicText: فَٱرْتَقِبْ يَوْمَ تَأْتِى ٱلسَّمَآءُ بِدُخَانٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	you	await	the	day	when	the	sky	will	
bring	forth	a	visible	smoke.	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	tum	us	din	ke	muntazir	raho	jab	āasmān	
aik	zāhir	dhuwāñ	lāye	gā

arabicText: يَغْشَى ٱلنَّاسَ ۖ هَـٰذَا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Which	will	envelop	the	people;	this	is	a	
painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	logoñ	ko	dhāñp	le	gā	yeh	hai	dardnāk	
áƶāb

arabicText: رَّبَّنَا ٱكْشِفْ عَنَّا ٱلْعَذَابَ إِنَّا مُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText: Thereupon	they	will	say,	“O	our	Lord!	Remove	the	punishment	from	us	-	we	now	accept	faith.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	din	kaheñ	ge	aey	hamāre	Rab	ham	par	se	'aƶāb	khol	de	ham	Imān	lāte	haiñ

arabicText: أَنَّىٰ لَهُمُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ وَقَدْ جَآءَهُمْ رَسُولٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
How	is	it	possible	for	them	to	accept	guidance,	whereas	a	Noble	Messenger	who	speaks	clearly	
has	already	come	to	them?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahāñ	se	ho	unheñ	nasiḥat	manna	ḥālānke	un	ke	pās	sāf	bayān	farmāne	wālā	Rasool	tashrif	lā	
chuka

arabicText: ثُمَّ تَوَلَّوْا۟ عَنْهُ وَقَالُوا۟ مُعَلَّمٌۭ مَّجْنُونٌ
englishTranslationText: Whereas	they	had	then	turned	away	from	him	and	said,	“He	is	a	madman,	tutored!”?
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	us	se	ru-gardāñ	huye	aur	bole	sikhāyā	huā	diwāna	hai

arabicText: إِنَّا كَاشِفُوا۟ ٱلْعَذَابِ قَلِيلًا ۚ إِنَّكُمْ عَآئِدُونَ
englishTranslationText: We	now	remove	the	punishment	for	some	days	-	so	you	will	again	commit	the	same.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ham	kuchh		dinoñ	ko	'aƶāb	khole	dete	haiñ	tum	phir	wohi		karo	ge

arabicText: يَوْمَ نَبْطِشُ ٱلْبَطْشَةَ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰٓ إِنَّا مُنتَقِمُونَ
englishTranslationText: The	day	when	We	will	seize	with	the	greatest	seizure	-	We	will	indeed	take	revenge.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	din	ham	sab	se	badi	pakad	pakdeñ	ge	be-shak	ham	badla	lene	wāle	haiñ.

arabicText: ۞ وَلَقَدْ فَتَنَّا قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَجَآءَهُمْ رَسُولٌۭ كَرِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	before	them	We	indeed	tried	the	people	of	Firaun,	and	an	Honourable	Noble	Messenger	came	
to	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	un	se	pahle	Fir'aun	ki	qaum	ko	jāñchā	aur	un	ke	pās	aik	mu'azzaz	Rasool	
tashrif	lāyā.

arabicText: أَنْ أَدُّوٓا۟ إِلَىَّ عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّى لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Who	said,	“Give	the	bondmen	of	Allah	into	my	custody;	I	am	indeed	a	trustworthy	Noble	
Messenger	for	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	Allāh	ke	bandoñ	ko	mujhe	supurd	kar	do	be-shak	maiñ	tumhāre	liye	amānat	wālā	Rasool	hoñ.

arabicText: وَأَن لَّا تَعْلُوا۟ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّىٓ ءَاتِيكُم بِسُلْطَـٰنٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	saying,	“And	do	not	rebel	against	Allah;	
I	have	brought	a	clear	proof	to	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ke	muqābil	sakashi	na	karo	maiñ	
tumhāre	pās	aik	roshan	sanad	lātā	hoñ

arabicText: وَإِنِّى عُذْتُ بِرَبِّى وَرَبِّكُمْ أَن تَرْجُمُونِ
englishTranslationText:
“And	I	take	the	refuge	of	my	Lord	and	
yours,	against	your	stoning	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	maiñ	panāh	letā	hoñ	apne	rab	aur	
tumhāre	rab	ki	is	se	ke	tum	mujhe	sangsār	
karo

arabicText: وَإِن لَّمْ تُؤْمِنُوا۟ لِى فَٱعْتَزِلُونِ
englishTranslationText:
“And	if	you	do	not	believe	in	me,	then	have	
no	relation	with	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tum	merā	yaqin	na	lāō	to	mujh	se	
kināre	ho	jāō

arabicText: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ قَوْمٌۭ مُّجْرِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	therefore	prayed	to	his	Lord,	“These	are	
a	guilty	nation!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	us	ne	apne	rab	se	du'ā	ki	ke	yeh	mujrim	
log	haiñ.

arabicText: فَأَسْرِ بِعِبَادِى لَيْلًا إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
We	commanded	him,	“Journey	with	My	
bondmen	in	a	part	of	the	night	-	you	will	be	
pursued.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
We	commanded	him,	“Journey	with	My	
bondmen	in	a	part	of	the	night	-	you	will	be	
pursued.”

arabicText: فَأَسْرِ بِعِبَادِى لَيْلًا إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
We	commanded	him,	“Journey	with	My	
bondmen	in	a	part	of	the	night	-	you	will	be	
pursued.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	ne	ḥukm	farmāyā	ke	mere	bandoñ	ko	
rātoñ	rāt	le	nikal	zaroor	tumhārā	pichā	kiyā	
jaye	gā

arabicText: وَٱتْرُكِ ٱلْبَحْرَ رَهْوًا ۖ إِنَّهُمْ جُندٌۭ مُّغْرَقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	leave	the	sea	as	it	is,	parted	in	several	
places;	indeed	that	army	will	be	drowned.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	dariyā	ko	yuñ	hi	jagah	jagah	se	khulā	
chord	de	be-shak	woh	lashkar	duboyā	jāye	
gā

arabicText: كَمْ تَرَكُوا۟ مِن جَنَّـٰتٍۢ وَعُيُونٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
How	many	gardens	and	water-springs	
they	left	behind!
romanUrduTranslationText: Kitne	chord	gaye	bāgh	aur	chashme.

arabicText: وَزُرُوعٍۢ وَمَقَامٍۢ كَرِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	fields	and	grand	palaces!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	khet	aur	'umdāh	makānāt

arabicText: وَنَعْمَةٍۢ كَانُوا۟ فِيهَا فَـٰكِهِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	favours	amongst	which	they	were	
rejoicing!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	n’emateñ	jin	meiñ	fārig-ul-bāl	they

arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَأَوْرَثْنَـٰهَا قَوْمًا ءَاخَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
That	is	what	We	did;	and	We	made	another	
nation	their	heirs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	ne	yuñ	hi		kiyā	aur	un	kā	wāris	doosri	
qaum	ko	kar	diyā

arabicText: فَمَا بَكَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ وَٱلْأَرْضُ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُنظَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	the	heavens	and	the	earth	did	not	weep	
for	them,	and	they	were	not	given	respite
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	un	par	āasmān	aur	zameen	na	roye	aur	
unheñ	muhlat	na	di	gayi

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ نَجَّيْنَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ مِنَ ٱلْعَذَابِ ٱلْمُهِينِ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	rescued	the	Descendants	of	
Israel	from	a	disgraceful	torture.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	bani	Isra’il	ko	ƶillat	ke	
'aƶāb	se	najāt	bakhshi

arabicText: مِن فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَالِيًۭا مِّنَ ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ
englishTranslationText:
From	Firaun;	he	was	indeed	proud,	among	
the	transgressors.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Fir'aun	se	be-shak	woh	mutakabbir	ḥad	se	
badhne	wāloñ	meiñ	se	thā.

arabicText: وَلَقَدِ ٱخْتَرْنَـٰهُمْ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ عَلَى ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	knowingly	chose	them,	among	all	
others	of	their	time.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	unheñ	dānista	chun	
liyā	us	zamāne	wāloñ	se.

arabicText: وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُم مِّنَ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ مَا فِيهِ بَلَـٰٓؤٌۭا۟ مُّبِينٌ
englishTranslationText: And	We	gave	them	signs	in	which	lay	clear	favours.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Ham	ne	unheñ	woh	nishāniyāñ	'aṭā	farmāyiñ	jin	meiñ	sariḥ	in'ām	thā

arabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَيَقُولُونَ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	these	disbelievers	proclaim;	-
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	yeh	kahte	haiñ.

arabicText: إِنْ هِىَ إِلَّا مَوْتَتُنَا ٱلْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُنشَرِينَ
englishTranslationText: There	is	nothing	except	our	dying	just	once,	and	we	will	not	be	raised.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	to	nahiñ	magar	hamārā	aik	daf'a	kā	marnā	aur	ham	uthāye	na	jāyeñ	ge

arabicText: فَأْتُوا۟ بِـَٔابَآئِنَآ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText: “Therefore	bring	back	our	forefathers,	if	you	are	truthful!”
romanUrduTranslationText: To	hamāre	bāp	dādā	ko	le	āaō	agar	tum	sachche	ho

arabicText: أَهُمْ خَيْرٌ أَمْ قَوْمُ تُبَّعٍۢ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ مُجْرِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Are	they	better,	or	the	people	of	Tubba?	And	those	who	were	before	them?	We	destroyed	them;	
they	were	indeed	criminals.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	woh	behtar	haiñ	yā	Tubb'a	ki	qaum	aur	jo	un	se	pahle	they	ham	ne	unheñ	halāk	kar	diyā	be
shak	woh	mujrim	log	they

arabicText: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا لَـٰعِبِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	We	did	not	create	the	heavens	and	the	earth,	and	all	that	is	between	them,	just	for	play.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Ham	ne	na	banāye	āasmān	aur	zameen,	aur	jo	kuch	un	ke	darmiyān	hai,	khel	ke	ṭaur	par.

arabicText: مَا خَلَقْنَـٰهُمَآ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText: We	did	not	create	them	except	with	the	truth,	but	most	of	them	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ham	ne	unheñ	na	banāyā	magar	Haq	ke	sāth	lekin	un	meiñ	aksar	jānte	nahiñ.

arabicText: إِنَّ يَوْمَ ٱلْفَصْلِ مِيقَـٰتُهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	the	Day	of	Decision	is	the	
appointment	for	all	of	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	faisle	kā	din	un	sab	ki	mi'ād	hai.

arabicText: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِى مَوْلًى عَن مَّوْلًۭى شَيْـًۭٔا وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	day	on	which,	no	friends	will	benefit	
each	other	at	all,	nor	will	they	be	helped.	
(Except those who are pious - see verse 
43:67)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	koyi	dost	kisi	dost	ke	kuch	kām	na	
āaye	gā	aur	na	un	ki	madad	hogi

arabicText: إِلَّا مَن رَّحِمَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	jis	par	Allāh	raḥem	kare	be-shak	
wohi		Ízzat	wālā	maherbān		hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ شَجَرَتَ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	the	tree	of	Zaqqum,
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	thohad	kā	ped

arabicText: طَعَامُ ٱلْأَثِيمِ
englishTranslationText: Is	the	food	of	the	sinners.
romanUrduTranslationText: Gunahgāroñ	ki	khurāk	hai

arabicText: كَٱلْمُهْلِ يَغْلِى فِى ٱلْبُطُونِ
englishTranslationText:
Like	molten	copper;	it	churns	in	their	
bellies.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Gale	huye	tāñbe	ki	ṭaraḥ	petoñ	meiñ	josh	
māre

arabicText: كَغَلْىِ ٱلْحَمِيمِ
englishTranslationText: Like	the	churning	of	boiling	water.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jaisā	khaultā	pāni	josh	māre

arabicText: خُذُوهُ فَٱعْتِلُوهُ إِلَىٰ سَوَآءِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
Seize	him,	and	forcibly	drag	him	right	to	
the	blazing	fire.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Usey	pakdo	thik	bhadakti	āag	ki	ṭaraf	
bāzor	ghaseet-te	le	jāō.

arabicText: ثُمَّ صُبُّوا۟ فَوْقَ رَأْسِهِۦ مِنْ عَذَابِ ٱلْحَمِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
“Then	pour	on	his	head	the	punishment	of	
boiling	water.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	us	ke	sar	ke	oopar	khaulte	pāni	kā	
'aƶāb	dālo

arabicText: ذُقْ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْكَرِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
Saying	“Taste	it!	Indeed	you	only	are	the	
most	honourable,	the	dignified!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Chakh	hāñ	hāñ	tu	hi	badā	'izzat	wālā	karam	
wālā	hai

arabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَمْتَرُونَ
englishTranslationText: “Indeed	this	is	what	you	used	to	doubt	about.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	yeh	hai	woh	jis	meiñ	tum	shubah	
karte	they

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى مَقَامٍ أَمِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	the	pious	are	in	a	place	of	peace.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	dar	wāle	amān	ki	jagah	meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: فِى جَنَّـٰتٍۢ وَعُيُونٍۢ
englishTranslationText: In	Gardens	and	water-springs.
romanUrduTranslationText: Bāghoñ	aur	chashmoñ	meiñ.

arabicText: يَلْبَسُونَ مِن سُندُسٍۢ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٍۢ مُّتَقَـٰبِلِينَ
englishTranslationText: They	will	be	dressed	in	fine	silk	and	embroidery,	facing	one	another	(on	thrones).
romanUrduTranslationText: Pahneñ	ge	kareb	aur	qnādeez	āamne	sāmne

arabicText: يَلْبَسُونَ مِن سُندُسٍۢ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٍۢ مُّتَقَـٰبِلِينَ
englishTranslationText: They	will	be	dressed	in	fine	silk	and	embroidery,	facing	one	another	(on	thrones).
romanUrduTranslationText: Pahneñ	ge	kareb	aur	qnādeez	āamne	sāmne

arabicText: كَذَٰلِكَ وَزَوَّجْنَـٰهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: So	it	is;	and	We	have	wedded	them	to	maidens	with	gorgeous	eyes.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yuñ	hi	hai	aur	Ham	ne	unheñ	biyāh	diyā	nihāyat	siyāh	aur	raushan	badi	āankhoñ	wāliyoñ	se.

arabicText: يَدْعُونَ فِيهَا بِكُلِّ فَـٰكِهَةٍ ءَامِنِينَ
englishTranslationText: In	it	they	will	ask	for	all	kinds	of	fruit,	with	safety.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	meiñ	har	qism	kā	mewa	māñgeñ	ge	amn-o-amān	se

arabicText: لَا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا ٱلْمَوْتَ إِلَّا ٱلْمَوْتَةَ ٱلْأُولَىٰ ۖ وَوَقَىٰهُمْ عَذَابَ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
They	will	not	taste	death	again	in	it,	except	their	former	death;	and	Allah	has	saved	them	from	
the	punishment	of	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	meiñ	pahli	maut	ke	siwā	phir	maut	na	chakheñ	ge	aur	Allāh	ne	unheñ	āag	ke	'aƶāb	se	bachā	
liyā

arabicText: فَضْلًۭا مِّن رَّبِّكَ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
englishTranslationText: By	the	munificence	of	your	Lord;	this	is	the	great	success.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumhāre	Rab	ke	fazl	se	yahi	badi	kāmyābi	hai.

arabicText: فَإِنَّمَا يَسَّرْنَـٰهُ بِلِسَانِكَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	We	have	made	this	Qur’an	easy	in	your	language,	for	them	to	understand.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	Ham	ne	is	Qur’ān	ko	tumhāri	zabān	meiñ	āasān	kiyā	ke	woh	samjheñ

arabicText: فَٱرْتَقِبْ إِنَّهُم مُّرْتَقِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	wait	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	-	they	too	are	
waiting.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	tum	intizār	karo	woh	bhi	kisi	intizār	mein	haiñ.

arabicText: حمٓ
englishTranslationText:
Ha-Meem*.(*Alphabets	of	the	Arabic	
language;	Allah	and	to	whomever	He	reveals,	
know	their	precise	meanings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ha-Meem*.	(*Arabi	zabān	ke	huroof	jin	ke	
ma’āni	Allah	aur	jis	par	Allah	ne	inko	nazil	
farmaya	Wahi	jānta	hai.)

arabicText: تَنزِيلُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
The	sending	down	of	the	Book	is	from	Allah,	
the	Most	Honourable,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kitāb	kā	utārnā	hai	Allāh	'izzat-o-ḥikmat	
wāle	ki	ṭaraf	se.

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	the	heavens	and	the	earth	are	
signs	for	believers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	meiñ	
nishāniyāñ	haiñ	Imān	wāloñ	ke	liye

arabicText: وَفِى خَلْقِكُمْ وَمَا يَبُثُّ مِن دَآبَّةٍ ءَايَـٰتٌۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يُوقِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	in	your	creation,	and	all	the	creatures	
He	scatters	in	the	earth	-	in	them	are	signs	
for	the	people	who	are	certain.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhāri	paidāish	meiñ	aur	jo	jo	jānwar	
woh	phailātā	hai	un	meiñ	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	
yaqin	wāloñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: وَٱخْتِلَـٰفِ ٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ وَمَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مِن رِّزْقٍۢ فَأَحْيَا بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا وَتَصْرِيفِ ٱلرِّيَـٰحِ ءَايَـٰتٌۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	in	the	alternation	of	night	and	day,	and	in	
the	means	of	sustenance	-	water	-	which	Allah	
sends	down	from	the	sky	whereby	He	gave	life	
to	the	earth	after	its	death,	and	in	the	
movement	of	the	winds	-	(in	all	these)	are	signs	
for	people	of	intellect.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	rāt	aur	din	ki	tabdilyoñ	meiñ	aur	us	meiñ	
ke	Allāh	ne	āasmān	se	rozi	kā	sabab	meñh	
utārā	to	us	se	zamiṇ	ko	us	ke	mare	piche	
zinda	kiyā	aur	hawāōñ	ki	gardish	meiñ	
nishāniyāñ	haiñ	'aql	mandoñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱللَّهِ نَتْلُوهَا عَلَيْكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۖ فَبِأَىِّ حَدِيثٍۭ بَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ وَءَايَـٰتِهِۦ يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
These	are	the	verses	of	Allah	which	We	recite	
to	you	with	the	truth;	so	forsaking	Allah	and	
His	signs,	what	will	they	believe	in?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	Allāh	ki	āayateñ	haiñ	ke	ham	tum	par	
ḥaq	ke	sāth	padhte	haiñ	phir	Allāh	aur	us	ki	
āayatoñ	ko	chod	kar	kaun	si	bāt	par	imāṇ	
lāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: وَيْلٌۭ لِّكُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Ruin	is	for	every	great	slanderer,	excessive	
sinner.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kharābi	hai	har	bade	bohtān	hāye	gunahgār	
ke	liye

arabicText: يَسْمَعُ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ثُمَّ يُصِرُّ مُسْتَكْبِرًۭا كَأَن لَّمْ يَسْمَعْهَا ۖ فَبَشِّرْهُ بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Who	hears	the	verses	of	Allah	which	are	
recited	to	him,	then	remains	stubborn,	
proud,	as	if	he	did	not	hear	them;	therefore	
give	him	the	glad	tidings	of	a	painful	
punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	ki	Āayatoñ	ko	sunta	hai	ke	us	par	padhi	
jāti	haiñ	phir	hat	par	jamtā	hai	ghuroor	kartā	
goyā	unheñ	sunā	hi	nahiñ	to	usey	
khushkahbti	sunāō	dard-nāk	'aƶāb	ki.

arabicText: وَإِذَا عَلِمَ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِنَا شَيْـًٔا ٱتَّخَذَهَا هُزُوًا ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ مُّهِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	he	comes	to	know	about	any	of	the	verses,	he	mocks	at	it;	for	them	is	a	disgraceful	
punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	Hamāri	Āayatoñ	meiñ	se	kisi	par	iṭṭilā'a	pāye	us	ki	hañsi	banātā	hai	un	ke	liye	khuwāri	kā	
'aƶāb.

arabicText: مِّن وَرَآئِهِمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَلَا يُغْنِى عَنْهُم مَّا كَسَبُوا۟ شَيْـًۭٔا وَلَا مَا ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَوْلِيَآءَ ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
Hell	is	after	them;	and	what	they	have	earned	will	not	benefit	them	at	all,	nor	those	whom	they	
have	chosen	as	supporters	besides	Allah;	and	for	them	is	a	terrible	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ke	peeche	Jahannam	hai	aur	unheñ	kuch	kām	na	de	gā	un	kā	kamāyā	huā	aur	na	woh	jo	Allāh	
ke	siwā	ḥimāyati	thahrā	rakhe	they	aur	un	ke	liye	badā	'aƶāb	hai.

arabicText: هَـٰذَا هُدًۭى ۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ مِّن رِّجْزٍ أَلِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	the	(true)	guidance;	and	for	those	who	disbelieve	in	the	verses	of	their	Lord	is	the	severest	
of	painful	punishments.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	rāḥ	dikhānā	hai	aur	jinhoñ	ne	apne	Rab	ki	āayatoñ	ko	na	mānā	un	ke	liye	dardnāk	'aƶāb	meiñ	
se	sakht	tar	'aƶāb	hai

arabicText: ۞ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى سَخَّرَ لَكُمُ ٱلْبَحْرَ لِتَجْرِىَ ٱلْفُلْكُ فِيهِ بِأَمْرِهِۦ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِهِۦ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah	Who	has	subjected	the	sea	for	you	so	that	ships	may	sail	upon	it	by	His	command,	and	
for	you	to	seek	His	munificence,	and	so	that	you	may	give	thanks.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	hai	jis	ne	tumhāre	bas	meiñ	dariyā	kar	diyā	ke	us	meiñ	us	ke	ḥukm	se	kashtiyāñ	chaliñ	aur	
is	liye	ke	us	kā	fazl	talāsh	karo	aur	is	liye	ke	ḥaq	māno

arabicText: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُم مَّا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًۭا مِّنْهُ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	has	subjected	for	you	all	whatever	is	in	the	heavens	and	in	the	earth,	by	His	command;	
indeed	in	this	are	signs	for	people	who	ponder.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhāre	kiye	kām	meiñ	lagāye	jo	kuch	āasmāṇoñ	meiñ	haiñ	aur	jo	kuch	zameen	meiñ	apne	
ḥukm	se	be-shak	is	meiñ	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	soñchne	wāloñ	ke	liye.

arabicText: قُل لِّلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يَغْفِرُوا۟ لِلَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ أَيَّامَ ٱللَّهِ لِيَجْزِىَ قَوْمًۢا بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Tell	the	believers	to	ignore	those	who	do	
not	expect	the	days	of	Allah,	in	order	that	
Allah	may	give	a	nation	the	reward	of	what	
they	used	to	earn.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Imāṇ	wāloñ	se	farmāō	darguzreñ	un	se	jo	
Allāh	ke	dinoñ	ki	ummid	nahiñ	rakhte	take	
Allāh	aik	qaum	ko	us	ki	kamāyi	kā	badla	de

arabicText: مَنْ عَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًۭا فَلِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَنْ أَسَآءَ فَعَلَيْهَا ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُمْ تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	does	a	good	deed,	so	it	is	for	his	
own	good;	and	whoever	commits	evil,	does	
for	his	own	harm;	and	you	will	then	be	
returned	towards	your	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	bhalā	kām	kare	to	apne	liye	aur	burā	
kare	to	apne	bure	ko	phir	apne	Rab	ki	ṭaraf	
phere	jāō	ge

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْحُكْمَ وَٱلنُّبُوَّةَ وَرَزَقْنَـٰهُم مِّنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ وَفَضَّلْنَـٰهُمْ عَلَى ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	gave	the	Descendants	of	
Israel	the	Book,	and	the	rule,	and	the	
Prophethood,	and	gave	good	things	for	
sustenance	and	gave	them	superiority	
over	all	others	of	their	time.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	ham	ne	bani	Isrā’il	ko	Kitāb	
aur	ḥukoomat	aur	Nubuwwat	'aṭā	farmāyi	
aur	ham	ne	unheñ	suthri	roziyāñ	diñ	aur	
unheñ	un	ke	zamāne	wāloñ	par	fazilat	
bakhshi.

arabicText: وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُم بَيِّنَـٰتٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلْأَمْرِ ۖ فَمَا ٱخْتَلَفُوٓا۟ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلْعِلْمُ بَغْيًۢا بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقْضِى بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فِيمَا كَانُوا۟ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	gave	them	clear	proofs	in	the	
command;	so	they	did	not	differ	except	
after	the	knowledge	had	come	to	them	-	
due	to	jealousy	among	themselves;	indeed	
your	Lord	will	judge	between	them	on	the	
Day	of	Resurrection	concerning	the	matter	
in	which	they	differ.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ham	ne	unheñ	us	kām	ki	raushan	
dalileñ	diñ	to	unhoñ	ne	ikhtilāf	na	kiyā	
magar	b'ad	is	ke	ke	'ilm	un	ke	pās	āa	chuka	
āapas	ke	ḥasad	se	be-shak	tumhārā	Rab	
Qiyāmat	ke	din	un	meiñ	faisla	kar	de	gā	jis	
bāt	meiñ	ikhtilāf	karte	haiñ.

arabicText: ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَـٰكَ عَلَىٰ شَرِيعَةٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلْأَمْرِ فَٱتَّبِعْهَا وَلَا تَتَّبِعْ أَهْوَآءَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ١٨
englishTranslationText:
We	then	placed	you	(O	dear	prophet	
Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	upon	the	clear	path	of	the	command,	
therefore	continue	following	it	and	do	not	
listen	to	the	desires	of	the	ignorant.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	ham	ne	is	kām	ke	'umdah	rāste	par	
tumheñ	kiyā	to	usi	rāh	chalo	aur	nādānoñ	
ki	khuwahishoñ	kā	sāth	na	do

arabicText: إِنَّهُمْ لَن يُغْنُوا۟ عَنكَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيْـًۭٔا ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلِيَآءُ بَعْضٍۢ ۖ وَٱللَّهُ وَلِىُّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	they	cannot	benefit	you	at	all	
against	Allah;	and	indeed	the	unjust	are	the	
friends	of	each	other;	and	Allah	is	the	Friend	of	the	pious
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	woh	Allāh	ke	muqābil	tumheñ	
kuchh		kām	na	deñ	ge	aur	be-shak	zālim	aik	
dosre	ke	dost	haiñ	aur	dar	wāloñ	kā	dost	
Allāh

arabicText: هَـٰذَا بَصَـٰٓئِرُ لِلنَّاسِ وَهُدًۭى وَرَحْمَةٌۭ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يُوقِنُونَ
englishTranslationText: This	is	an	enlightenment	for	mankind,	and	a	guidance	and	mercy	for	the	people	of	faith.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yeh	logoñ	ki	āañkheñ	kholnā	hai	aur	Imān	wāloñ	ke	liye	hidāyat-o-raḥmat.

arabicText: أَمْ حَسِبَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱجْتَرَحُوا۟ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ أَن نَّجْعَلَهُمْ كَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ سَوَآءًۭ مَّحْيَاهُمْ وَمَمَاتُهُمْ ۚ سَآءَ مَا يَحْكُمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Do	those	who	commit	evil	assume	that	We	will	make	them	equal	to	those	who	believe	and	do	
good	deeds,	therefore	both	becoming	equal	in	life	and	death?	What	an	evil	judgement	they	
impose!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	jinhoñ	ne	burāiyoñ	kā	irtikāb	kiyā	yeh	samajhte	haiñ	ke	unheñ	un	jaisā	kar	deñ	ge	jo	imān	
lāye	aur	achchhe	kām	kiye	ke	un	ki	zindagi	aur	maut	barābar	ho	jāye?	Kiyā	hi	burā	ḥukm	lagāte	
haiñ

arabicText: وَخَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلِتُجْزَىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Allah	has	created	the	heavens	and	the	earth	with	the	truth,	and	so	that	every	soul	is	repaid	
for	what	it	has	earned,	and	they	will	not	be	wronged.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	ne	āasmānoñ	aur	zamin	ko	ḥaq	ke	sāth	banāyā	aur	is	liye	ke	har	jān	apne	kiye	kā	badla	
pāye	aur	un	par	zulm	na	hogā.

arabicText: أَفَرَءَيْتَ مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَـٰهَهُۥ هَوَىٰهُ وَأَضَلَّهُ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍۢ وَخَتَمَ عَلَىٰ سَمْعِهِۦ وَقَلْبِهِۦ وَجَعَلَ عَلَىٰ بَصَرِهِۦ غِشَـٰوَةًۭ فَمَن يَهْدِيهِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Just	look	at	him	who	makes	his	desire	as	
his	God,	and	Allah	has	sent	him	astray	
despite	his	having	knowledge,	and	set	a	
seal	upon	his	ears	and	his	heart,	and	a	
covering	upon	his	eyes;	so	who	will	guide	
him	after	Allah?	So	do	you	not	ponder?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bhalā	dekho	to	woh	jis	ne	apni	khwāhish	
ko	apnā	khudā	thahrā	liyā	aur	Allāh	ne	
usey	bā	wasf	'ilm	ke	gumrāh	kiyā	aur	us	ke	
kān	aur	dil	par	muhar	lagā	di	aur	us	ki	
āañkhoñ	par	parda	dālā	to	Allāh	ke	b'ad	
usey	kaun	rāh	dikhāye	to	kyā	tum	dhiyān	
nahiñ	karte.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ مَا هِىَ إِلَّا حَيَاتُنَا ٱلدُّنْيَا نَمُوتُ وَنَحْيَا وَمَا يُهْلِكُنَآ إِلَّا ٱلدَّهْرُ ۚ وَمَا لَهُم بِذَٰلِكَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَظُنُّونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	said,	“There	is	nothing	except	our	
life	of	this	world	-	we	die	and	we	live	-	and	
nothing	destroys	us	except	the	passage	of	
time”;	and	they	do	not	have	any	knowledge	
of	it;	they	only	make	guesses.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	woh	to	nahiñ	magar	yahi	hamāri	
duniyā	ki	zindagi	marte	haiñ	aur	jeete	haiñ	
aur	hameñ	halāk	nahiñ	kartā	magar	
zamāna	aur	unheñ	is	kā	'Ilm	nahiñ	woh	to	
nire	gumān	daudāte	haiñ

arabicText: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتُنَا بَيِّنَـٰتٍۢ مَّا كَانَ حُجَّتَهُمْ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوا۟ ٱئْتُوا۟ بِـَٔابَآئِنَآ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	Our	clear	verses	are	recited	to	
them,	their	only	argument	is,	“Bring	back	
our	forefathers,	if	you	are	truthful!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	un	par	Hamāri	raushan	Āayateñ	
padhi	jāyeñ	to	bas	un	ki	ḥujjat	yahi	hoti	hai	
ke	kahte	haiñ	hamāre	bāp	dādā	ko	le	āaō		
tum	agar	sachche	ho

arabicText: قُلِ ٱللَّهُ يُحْيِيكُمْ ثُمَّ يُمِيتُكُمْ ثُمَّ يَجْمَعُكُمْ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“It	is	
Allah	Who	gives	you	life,	then	will	give	you	
death,	then	will	gather	you	all	on	the	Day	
of	Resurrection	in	which	there	is	no	doubt,	
but	most	people	do	not	know.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	Allah	tumheñ	jilātā	hai	phir	
tum	ko	māre	gā	phir	tum	sab	ko	ikat_thā	
kare	gā	Qiyāmat	ke	din	jis	meiñ	koyi	shak	
nahiñ	lekin	bahut	āadmi	nahiñ	jānte

arabicText: وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَيَوْمَ تَقُومُ ٱلسَّاعَةُ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ يَخْسَرُ ٱلْمُبْطِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	to	Allah	only	belongs	the	kingship	of	
the	heavens	and	the	earth;	and	when	the	
Last	Day	is	established	-	on	that	day	the	
followers	of	falsehood	will	suffer	loss.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allāh	hi	ke	liye	hai	āasmānoñ	aur	
zameen	ki	salṭānat	aur	jis	din	Qiyāmat	
qāim	hogi	bāṭil	wāloñ	ki	us	din	hār	hai

arabicText: وَتَرَىٰ كُلَّ أُمَّةٍۢ جَاثِيَةًۭ ۚ كُلُّ أُمَّةٍۢ تُدْعَىٰٓ إِلَىٰ كِتَـٰبِهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	you	will	see	every	group	down	on	its	
knees;	every	group	will	be	called	towards	
its	book	of	deeds;	“This	day	you	will	be	
repaid	for	what	you	did.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tum	har	giroh	ko	dekho	ge	zānoo	ke	
bal	gire	huye	har	giroh	apne	Nama-e
A'amāl	ki	ṭaraf	bulāyā	jāye	gā	āaj	tumheñ	
tumhāre	kiye	kā	badla	diyā	jāye	gā.

arabicText: هَـٰذَا كِتَـٰبُنَا يَنطِقُ عَلَيْكُم بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا نَسْتَنسِخُ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“This	Book	of	Ours	speaks	against	you	with	
the	truth;	indeed	We	had	been	recording	
all	what	you	did.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hamārā	yeh	nawishta	tum	par	ḥaq	boltā	
hai,	ham	likhte	rahe	they	jo	tum	ne	kiyā.

arabicText: فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَيُدْخِلُهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ فِى رَحْمَتِهِۦ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
englishTranslationText:
So	those	who	believed	and	did	good	deeds	-	their	Lord	will	admit	them	into	His	mercy;	this	is	the	
clear	triumph.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	woh	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achchhe	kām	kiye	
un	kā	Rab	unheñ	apni	Raḥmat	meiñ	le	gā	yahi	khuli	kāmyābi	hai.

arabicText: وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَفَلَمْ تَكُنْ ءَايَـٰتِى تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَٱسْتَكْبَرْتُمْ وَكُنتُمْ قَوْمًۭا مُّجْرِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	to	those	who	disbelieved,	it	will	be	said	“Was	it	not	that	Our	verses	were	recited	to	you?	In	
response	you	were	haughty	and	were	a	guilty	people.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	kāfir	huye	un	se	farmāyā	jāye	gā	kyā	na	thā	ke	meri	Āayateñ	padhi	jāti	thiñ	to	tum	takabbur	
karte	they	aur	tum	mujrim	log	they.

arabicText: وَإِذَا قِيلَ إِنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّۭ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهَا قُلْتُم مَّا نَدْرِى مَا ٱلسَّاعَةُ إِن نَّظُنُّ إِلَّا ظَنًّۭا وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُسْتَيْقِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	when	it	was	said,	‘Indeed	Allah’s	promise	is	true	and	there	is	no	doubt	regarding	the	Last	
Day”,	you	used	to	say,	‘We	do	not	know	what	the	Last	Day	is	-	we	think	it	is	nothing	except	an	
imagination,	and	we	are	not	convinced.’	”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	kahā	jātā	be-shak	Allāh	kā	w'ada	sachchā	hai	aur	Qayāmat	meiñ	shak	nahiñ	tum	kahte	
ham	nahiñ	jānte	Qayāmat	kyā	chiz	hai	hameñ	to	yuñ	hi	kuch	gumān	sa	hotā	hai	aur	hameñ	yaqeen	
nahiñ
